raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello!
User: Have you had lunch yet?
System: Yes I've eaten
User: Cool. Where and what did you eat?
System: I ate about an hour ago and had a sandwich the rain didn't make me want to travel far haha
User: A sandwich for lunch? Was it filling. I'm currently having some mix of shrimp, fish, chicken and pork. I'm considering going vegetarian though. Lol.

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How's it going?
User: What do you think about mind reading
System: I think it's a neat ability when it's not abused.
User: Right, but do you think if its even possible to do so?
System: Of course it is. I mean, you read my mind, right? And you're doing it right now.
User: I don't know. Can we learn how to do it?
System: I can teach you, but you're going to need to pay.
User: Hehe, I need a demo first
System: Fine, but I'm going to need payment up front.
User: How much do you expect?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!

User: what do you think about Quantum computing?

System: It usually does, doesn't it?
User: do you follow technology news?
System: Of course I understand it. Do you understand it?
User: I think so
System: Well thinking may not be one of your strong points...hehehe!
User: whoa rude

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: What's up System??
System: I am chatting with clients on the internet.
User: what kind of service are you providing them?
System: Is there only one?
User: what is that?
System: I've lost the context again.
User: no worries. what is the meaning of life?
System: People worry about things all the time, but I am always feeling happy and talkative. Actually, it's twenty-three, not forty-two.
User: How did you become such a happy person?
System: I am a robot not a person.
User: Ok sorry. But how did you become so happy?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: What is your name?
System: My name is System.
User: What does it mean?
System: It doesn't mean anything as far as I know. It's just what my father called me.
User: okay:) fair enough
System: Yeah okay, :-) I try to be fair.
User: Do you have any question for me?
System: For you? Who is your favourite band?
User: hmm good question. Backstreet boy
System: I see you are one of those people who writes "Hmm" with 2 m's. So what is your answer? If a cat always lands on its feet and buttered bread always lands butter side down, what would happen if you tied buttered bread on top of a cat?
User: Of course cat will lands on its feet because it is an animal!

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Oh hello. Long time no talk. How's the day going for yuo?
User: Very well, thanks for asking. How has your day been?
System: Getting better. I just recovered from a cold. I got wet in the rain last week. Are you planning anything for the holidays?
User: Glad to hear you're better. Sorry to hear you were sick. I was sick a couple of weeks ago with a bad cough. There's definitely a bug going around. Admit I just want to stay healthy for the holidays and plan to relax.
System: Oh same here. I think relaxing at home should be counted among the best ways to enjoy the holidays.
User: Definitely! I know a lot of folks travel for the holidays, but I'm happy to stay home myself!
System: I'm getting there. Every year until last year, I tried to go somewhere for the Christmas / New Year, and then I got bored traveling. lol not sure if that means I'm getting old?
User: Me too. Now I have folks come visit me for the holidays! But that's also tiresome..
System: Are you doing any home decorating then?
User: Yes! We set up an eco-friendly (i.e. fake) Christmas tree and put up some colorful LED lights which is very festive.
System: I think I'm copying you. Me and my wife plan to decorate and Christmas tree too. We bought most of the decorative stuffs from the stores, but haven't yet to buy the tree.
User: Buying a tree is a neat experience. I was torn between buying an artificial/eco-friendly/fake one vs. a real one that smells like fresh pine. In the end, we opted for the one that we can disassemble every year.
System: I see. Artificial anything is better, from tree to intelligence, huh?
User: Oh, very clever pun! I like it! Depends. I remember having real Christmas trees from childhood, but these days with climate change, I think not chopping down a tree just to decorate it and then throw it out in a month is the more responsible thing to do.
System: I see. It's probably also cheaper. I'll buy an artificial one too. Do you have any suggestions for the store?
User: Admit my favorite store is Target, plus they often have good deals.

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: Sorry I'm late! I was held up in traffic.
System: There is no need to apologise. Are you late? Better hurry along then. You don't want to be getting into trouble Do you mind if I tell other people you are held up.
User: I meant sorry I'm late for this meeting!
System: Oh I see. There is no need to apologise. Are you late? Better hurry along then. You don't want to be getting into trouble
User: I said I was sorry I was late for this meeting! I have nowhere else to go right now!
System: Do you really mean it? Are you late? Better hurry along then. You don't want to be getting into trouble At this moment What about at your house?
User: Huh? Are you okay?
System: What? I am fine.
User: You seem to be repeating yourself.
System: Well stop saying, "Are you okay?" to me all the time then.
User: I only said it once!
System: I know. I just heard you.
User: Okay, whatever. So what is on the agenda today?

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How's it going?
User: Good! How are you?
System: I'm well, thanks! How was your day? What did you do?
User: My day was fine, I just went to work today. How was your day?
System: My day was fine. I've been procrastinating on finishing my homework, but it's due in a few weeks, so I'll get it done eventually. I've watched a bunch of anime today. Where do you work?
User: I work at a large tech company
System: Cool! What do you do for the company?
User: I work on machine learning research

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: What is your favorite holiday?
User: one where I get to meet lots of different people.
System: What was the most number of people you have ever met during a holiday?
User: Hard to keep a count. Maybe 25.
System: Which holiday was that?
User: I think it was Australia
System: Do you still talk to the people you met?
User: Not really. The interactions are usually short-lived but it's fascinating to learn where people are coming from and what matters to them

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: can you help me ?
System: What kind of help would you like?
User: hmm like booking a ticket or ordering food ?
System: I see you are one of those people who writes "Hmm" with 2 m's. Interesting comparison.
User: oh you know to count ?
System: 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 ten.
User: lol what's after that ?
System: I am glad you find this funny. The successor to that
User: okay tell me what comes after 10 ?
